data.text:
"The UN will continue to work together with the African Union and regional and international partners to support the Ethiopian people on the way to peace and reconciliation.   
 
Now is the time to put an end to the suffering."   

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/IVsYSuOvi0

.@WFP has been in Afghanistan since 1963, ensuring that assistance reaches those in need wherever they are.
Despite security & logistics challenges, our colleagues remain committed to stay & deliver to the most vulnerable. https://t.co/3bKlecYRkK

 https://t.co/JT7NIn2Xro

On Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay, we remember our 22 colleagues who lost their lives when the UN in Baghdad was bombed in 2003.

Today and every day, we thank the brave humanitarians who risk their lives to make the world a better place. https://t.co/UFEDkSYrbA

Misinformation is costing lives and prolonging the #COVID19 pandemic.

Whether you’re forwarding a message, retweeting or watching a video -- take a moment to PAUSE & verify facts before you share. https://t.co/fBGWhntIrq #PledgeToPause https://t.co/n4EajyC7LX

Every day, brave humanitarians around the world step up to help others & save lives despite multiple challenges and threats.

On Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay, we pay tribute to those real life heroes. https://t.co/sWSwTPP0gR

From Afghanistan to Haiti and many other places around the world, when crises erupt, humanitarians work tirelessly in service to humanity. 

Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay is an opportunity to say: THANK YOU! https://t.co/QhK1bJTB9w

"We owe it to our peacekeepers and to the populations we protect."

-- @antonioguterres says accelerating the shift towards innovative, data-driven & technology-enabled @UNPeacekeeping is essential. 
https://t.co/1ecJkvxfNp

🔹 Humanity
🔹 Neutrality
🔹 Impartiality
🔹 Independence

4 humanitarian principles for Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay & every day. https://t.co/C8vMoXwYPa https://t.co/HmJPpu9O3T

Afghanistan: Delivery of lifesaving aid & medical supplies to millions of people must not be cut, @WHO said on Wednesday, joining other UN agencies in stressing that their staff will remain in the country & are committed to supporting the most vulnerable. 
https://t.co/Ot93kdSs9G

Haiti: Destruction & desperation becoming increasingly evident four days after a deadly earthquake hit the country. 

The UN is on the ground providing food, water, medical supplies, emergency shelter & more. https://t.co/uDz1CQ6fSy

The climate emergency is a humanitarian crisis. 

On Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay, join #TheHumanRace in solidarity with those most affected by climate-related disasters. https://t.co/0kFVmE1vkn via @UNOCHA https://t.co/2thBdrDENF

Millions of Afghans - including women & girls, whose hard-won rights must be protected – need urgent assistance.

Here's how you can help us & our humanitarian partners provide them with life-saving aid & protection. https://t.co/b4ZQED8UeH https://t.co/MsJgql9Ei9

Attacks on journalists are attacks on freedom of expression. 

Now, more than ever, we need facts and a free press. 

Defending journalism is standing up for democracy. https://t.co/fXyyqd5E6u via @UNESCO https://t.co/Gjq2pNjE8F

Haiti: @UNICEF is on the ground providing emergency aid following this weekend's devastating earthquake. 

More than half a million children & their families were affected by the disaster.

Your donation can help alleviate their suffering. 👇

https://t.co/a8I8I6WoQd

Everyone has the right to life, liberty & security of person.

Around the world, UNHCR works to save lives, protect rights & build a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities & stateless people. https://t.co/fJ7wnNvfzK via @Refugees https://t.co/Y4wjs19CO2

Wednesday marks three years since the passing of former UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, regarded by so many around the world as a guiding force for good.

Today and every day, we remember him. 
https://t.co/kLQ9AmvPB9 https://t.co/vjWngy1ehL

Happy birthday to our Goodwill Ambassador @EdwardNorton! 🎉
And, thank you for your tireless commitment to #ClimateAction.

Here's how you can join him and #ActNow to protect our planet: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/w7EGFkpqdW
Afghanistan: UN agencies maintain presence in country to deliver vital humanitarian aid to civilians amid ongoing violence & human rights abuses. https://t.co/yUcigHvMiL

Mercury is one of the most dangerous chemicals to human health & the environment.

@UNEP explains why it's important to #MakeMercuryHistory to protect people & the planet: https://t.co/DYgN1vZpBE

Fuel crisis jeopardizes health & water systems in Lebanon, putting thousands of families at risk of a humanitarian catastrophe, warns UN Humanitarian Coordinator in the country @rochdi_najat. https://t.co/2DzOVn9Sb2

The United Nations in Afghanistan reiterates its commitment to remain in the country & deliver aid to millions of people in need. 

The majority of humanitarian personnel are staying to support the humanitarian response. 
https://t.co/KFBfyYxhVj

Ebola vaccinations have begun for high-risk populations in Côte d’Ivoire, including first responders & health workers, amid country's first outbreak of the disease in 25 years. https://t.co/9nAhK2V0nd

Afghanistan: Child casualties hit record high this year, with hundreds killed or maimed in recent weeks amid the deteriorating political & security situation, warns new @childreninwar report.
https://t.co/f98Hfzu5Bd

The climate crisis is here & no region is immune.

Latin America & the Caribbean experienced drought, tropical storms, heatwave, heavy rainfall, hurricanes & catastrophic wildfires in the Amazon in 2020. 

More reasons for #ClimateAction from @WMO: https://t.co/0ZgHIS0CQD https://t.co/cm9ajuzVkv

Abusive work environments damage the health, safety & productivity of employees. 

Everyone, everywhere, should be able to work free from violence, intimidation & harassment. https://t.co/JHBKERs1DE via @ILO https://t.co/lGMoerAiw7

The climate crisis is here & no country or region is immune, but all of us can take #ClimateAction to help protect our planet. 

You can stay updated on climate science & the latest developments with the climate newsletter from @UN_News_Centre:  https://t.co/FPq5TR1Rkz https://t.co/8PSkDRQH4w

Amid ongoing clashes in southern Syria, @UNRWA urges unimpeded access for humanitarian assistance to help thousands of vulnerable Palestine refugees. 

https://t.co/msprrRMRin

Powerful new @UNOCHA exhibit shows the lasting impact of the climate emergency through the stories of people from around the world.

Meet some of those most directly affected by the crisis: https://t.co/nUe3oEcCLR https://t.co/fUNH6dG8Nw

When girls & young women miss out on their right to education, the impact on communities lasts for generations.

More on the vital importance of inclusive & equitable education for all: https://t.co/KnCtlYRijh #GlobalGoals https://t.co/10lF11xZrF

"I call for an immediate end to violence, for the rights of all Afghans to be respected & for Afghanistan to comply with all international agreements to which it is a party."

-- @antonioguterres to Security Council. 
https://t.co/VfsQVIWB4o

Haiti: UN is on the ground providing humanitarian aid after this weekend's devastating earthquake, including food, clean water, health care & shelter for the displaced ahead of torrential storm expected to bring flash floods & mudslides.

https://t.co/dEBkZev1b8

Each and every one of us needs to #ActNow to ensure sustainable consumption & production to protect our planet.

Take #ClimateAction by choosing eco-friendly goods and services. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/fkhYTWs7al

"We cannot and must not abandon the people of Afghanistan."  

-- @antonioguterres urges the international community to stand, work & act together to uphold human rights for all & ensure Afghanistan is never again used as a safe haven for terrorists. https://t.co/A3NJ6HC8Yb https://t.co/zPHqLRpu2R

The right to food is a human right. 

See how @FAO works to achieve #ZeroHunger & ensure everyone has access to sufficient, safe, nutritious & affordable food. https://t.co/sNHUkJ0hca
 https://t.co/4bikKp5taK

Gender equality is required to achieve all the #GlobalGoals and key to a better world!

@UN_Women has tips on how you can help achieve #GenerationEquality. https://t.co/sE79GI2Df0 https://t.co/0gxgcJaTwB

Investing in youth is investing in our shared future. 

In 2020, 15 million school children around the world received nutritious meals and snacks from @WFP, helping them to learn, grow & thrive.

More: https://t.co/Ri4U6jGeNR https://t.co/ihNwkAmlWJ

The climate emergency is a humanitarian crisis. 

Ahead of next week's #WorldHumanitarianDay, @UNOCHA is urging everyone to show solidarity with people most affected by the climate crisis. 

Join #TheHumanRace: https://t.co/agF7ZANTU8

There is enough food in the world to feed everyone on this planet. Yet, hundreds of millions of people go hungry while 1/3 of our food goes to waste. 

#ActNow: Only buy what you need – and use what you buy. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/6L7U6bS88T

People around the world are taking the #PledgeToPause & verify facts before sharing online.

Join them & help stop the spread of harmful misinformation amid the #COVID19 pandemic: https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/5MJkLJw9wA

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

As hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia are on the rise, each of us can #StandUp4HumanRights, and help #FightRacism, discrimination & hatred: https://t.co/Ijz1XW8dey https://t.co/QjgSyb9KWP

.@UNOOSA Chief Simonetta Di Pippo talks about the importance of space activities & technologies and how they can help create a better world for all in the first episode of season 4 of our podcast 'Awake At Night' with @MelissaFleming. 

🎧: https://t.co/jse7pYinxf https://t.co/V7bDWzGat2

Gender equality can be a catalyst for addressing the crises brought on by #COVID19, the climate emergency and biodiversity loss. 

@UNDP's @ljmaguire explains what that means for Latin American and the Caribbean: https://t.co/4OFD8FgdpG

Women play a critical role in achieving lasting peace around the world. 

Women in @UNPeacekeeping missions:
☑️ help reduce conflict,
☑️ serve as role models,
☑️ provide greater sense of security & more. 

https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh https://t.co/Z2L4vTkX7a

♻ Reduce
♻ Repair
♻ Reuse
♻ Recycle

Take #ClimateAction by making small changes in your daily life to reduce waste. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo #ActNow https://t.co/qQq2q0NI8G

Your shares on social media can have far-reaching consequences in the real world, especially as misinformation causes global harm amid #COVID19. 

#PledgeToPause & take time to verify facts & sources before you share something online. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/ZRIEj7EEyb

Decades of war have taken an immeasurable toll on Afghanistan, one of the countries most affected by landmines & explosive remnants of war in the world. 

Read how @UNMAS is working to protect civilians from explosive hazards in Afghanistan: https://t.co/PiqM3ZKVAR https://t.co/TjYAmZaM2X

This week's @IPCC_CH climate report is a code red for humanity. 

The alarm bells are deafening & the evidence is irrefutable: greenhouse gas emissions are choking our planet & putting billions of people at risk. 

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/ERCnwjOtHj https://t.co/WiVuOR4FUy

The UN's #ActNow campaign is teaming up with the European Union & the Smurfs to inspire people to help clean beaches & riverbanks around the world.

Join the #EUBeachCleanUp and take #ClimateAction:
https://t.co/i5dQr2oso2 https://t.co/jtGqeMahNQ

Millions of tonnes of food are wasted every year. The majority of this food loss takes places in households.

@FAO has tips on how you can reduce food waste in your home. https://t.co/cunVOH3M4c https://t.co/GWzgL3hPoy

"This is the moment to halt the offensive. This is the moment to start serious negotiation. This is the moment to avoid a prolonged civil war or the isolation of Afghanistan." 

-- @antonioguterres calls on Taliban to negotiate in good faith. https://t.co/IYiPjr6Gvn https://t.co/dB9J5Fn6JC

Independent @UNHumanRights experts express alarm at rampant police brutality against peaceful protesters worldwide and warn of grave danger for human rights and rule of law. 
https://t.co/ZBNQCZDCCS

"Only an Afghan-led negotiated political settlement can ensure peace."

-- @antonioguterres says UN determined to contribute to settlement, promote rights of all Afghans & provide life-saving humanitarian help to increasing number of civilians in need. https://t.co/7K5BOsBaGW

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, war or disaster at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/rtosk2ky10 via @Refugees https://t.co/z7iU8gBaqU

Are you interested in working for the UN?

Here are some tips for job interviews from @UN_Careers:
☑Prepare stories about your accomplishments
☑Be ready to discuss your ability to learn from experience
☑Listen to questions carefully

More info: https://t.co/J6VgGEYRTJ https://t.co/0j8pL34Dfx

.@UNStamps is honouring the life and legacy of Nobel laurate Mother Teresa for her tireless efforts on behalf of some of the world's most vulnerable people. 

Get your stamps at: https://t.co/0RwXCPMTWS https://t.co/WhYQ9sug5Q

Friday marks 60 years since construction began on the #BerlinWall.

A section of it, entitled "Trophy of Civil Rights", was gifted to the UN by Germany and is displayed at UNHQ in NYC as a reminder that we can all #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/nBkMi9KFtt

Households consume 29% of global energy

📌 Turn off the lights you don't need.
📌 Switch to LED light bulbs.
📌 Air dry clothes.
These are a few ways you can save electricity at home & take #ClimateAction.

More ideas about how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/qNyfy4A6eH https://t.co/np2FW4DNWK

"The United Nations stands ready to continue to support Somalia in this election process and beyond, so that the country can renew its focus on core peace, security, and development goals."

-- @UNSomalia chief James Swan to Security Council. https://t.co/Jo0RiXEEoK

"Young people must be full partners in our efforts to build an inclusive, fair and sustainable world for all." -- @antonioguterres

See how the UN celebrated youth engagement around the world on Thursday's #YouthDay in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/D7DrGbEBJJ

Simple steps can help you beat the heat when temperatures are on the rise:
➡️ Stay in the shade
➡️ Remain indoors during hottest times of the day
➡️ Drink plenty of water
➡️ Avoid strenuous activities

@WHO has more tips: https://t.co/cfuoK2EDhx https://t.co/EYnwhDIGWa

Here's how you can help protect elephants:
❌ Don’t invest in ivory as a commodity.
🐘 Inform people about the importance of protecting elephants
🐘 Learn about conservation projects that support elephants

On Thursday's #WorldElephantDay, go #WildForLife: https://t.co/ZiUC1DC3oq https://t.co/t4AUqBjISB

"I urge everyone to guarantee young people a seat at the table as we build a world based on inclusive, fair and sustainable development for all."

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's #YouthDay. https://t.co/eLUcgJJRcs https://t.co/tR68aiZ6Rv

Girls of today become the leaders of tomorrow. They should be supported to realize their full potential. 

On #YouthDay & every day, @UN_Women works to achieve #GenerationEquality by empowering women & girls. https://t.co/QQRFPY4VRn

🎨: Jessica Quispe https://t.co/oYmuEURxMF

The latest @IPCC_CH report confirms it: 
The climate crisis is affecting every region of the world and we need urgent #ClimateAction to protect our planet and our future. 

Find out how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/mkuOb977uL

Human activities have had a dramatic impact on elephant populations.

On Thursday's #WorldElephantDay, @UNDP explains how DNA forensics can hold traffickers accountable for their crimes against wildlife, ecosystems, nature -- and all of humanity. https://t.co/qSPBbTbj8e

Young people around the world are taking #ClimateAction & tackling inequities in food security, helping to achieve a more nutritious & sustainable future for all.

More on Thursday's #YouthDay: https://t.co/mHcbkGUTTa https://t.co/8B0b8MR4Tn

Following the confirmation of the first-ever case of Marburg disease in Guinea and West Africa, @WHO is assisting in investigation of outbreak of the highly infectious disease that causes hemorrhagic fever. https://t.co/NmOlvsQGdd

Even before #COVID19, women did 3 times as much domestic & care work as men - and the pandemic has placed additional pressures on women, often with negative impacts on their well-being. 

@UNWomen explain how we can all help achieve #GenerationEquality: https://t.co/rkTWmgz5Ci https://t.co/xLsxRMjrgB

"If we combine forces now, we can avert climate catastrophe." 

-- @antonioguterres in the wake of recent @IPCC_CH report on the worsening threat of the climate crisis. 

"There is no time for delay and no room for excuses." 
https://t.co/ERCnwjOtHj https://t.co/KaSYbE3SbU

Lace up your shoes & join #TheHumanRace to show solidarity with people around the world affected by the climate crisis.

This #WorldHumanitarianDay - and every day - we can all do our part to take #ClimateAction. https://t.co/agF7ZB5viI https://t.co/p6sRp1zWGq

Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it: #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation -- and the virus. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/LFIs8aHCVH

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The survival of animals, the frequency of disasters, the spread of diseases & more hinge on these few degrees.

We need #ClimateAction now. https://t.co/dDZ0DeYPhW via @UNFCCC https://t.co/EccE8ou2gY

UN peacekeepers come from different countries, cultures & backgrounds, but share a common purpose: to improve lives and further peace around the world.

More on the important protection work of @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/1AkYG74EeJ https://t.co/zCRvt6In5B

"Climate change is here, now. 
But we are also here, now. 
And if we don't act, who will?"

-- @UNEP chief @andersen_inger on the need for urgent #ClimateAction in the wake of major @IPCC_CH report on the worsening threat of the climate emergency. https://t.co/9TswCXfMtL https://t.co/Rts5PbeauS

As violence in Afghanistan is escalating, @UNICEF is scaling up delivery of lifesaving water & medical supplies, while calling for protection & peace for all children now. https://t.co/6Y4W91KoNU

 https://t.co/7VD9pweHL5

Myanmar: Situation remains very worrisome as military leaders attempt to legitimize their power and severe third wave of #COVID19 threatens the country, UN Special Envoy @SchranerBurgen1 said on Tuesday. 
https://t.co/ABEmFVA7Jw

Afghanistan: Fighting must stop to prevent more bloodshed, @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet urges amid rising violence & human rights violations.
https://t.co/5eig9GIh7c

🐝 Bees are tiny food heroes -- without them, most of the food we eat wouldn't exist. 

⚠️ But bees & other pollinators are in danger! 

@FAO has more on how beekeepers & others are working to protect these tiny miracle workers: https://t.co/U56LK6Rx39
https://t.co/mjpfBqe5L3

Less than a century ago, there were more than 200k lions in Africa. Today, there are only about 20k left.  

Habitat loss, poaching & illegal trade are some of the major threats 🦁🦁 face. 

On Tuesday's #WorldLionDay, see how YOU can help protect them: https://t.co/fGSBGeBjgJ https://t.co/tATfNiTBOV

156 million children worldwide are still out of school due to #COVID19.

Getting students back in their classrooms & supporting them to readjust & catch-up on their learning is critical for their well-being & future. https://t.co/pnBZTeSPGp via @UNICEF https://t.co/1WNafR5GhG

Lion populations have dropped by more than 40% in the last two decades. 

Unrestricted exploitation of wildlife threatens our biological diversity & causes ecological imbalance.

On Tuesday's #WorldLionDay, see how @UNEP works to protect our ecosystems: https://t.co/kv0mWte4iA https://t.co/qQ2kyUh1rJ

On Monday’s #IndigenousDay, the UN celebrated indigenous people everywhere & their invaluable contributions to our world. 

See some examples in our latest @TwitterMoments. https://t.co/41IYTyNK7D

Amid increase in piracy and armed robbery of ships, stronger international cooperation is needed to enhance security for seafarers & stop crime at sea.

https://t.co/RgizcX15dp

"If we combine forces now, we can avert climate catastrophe."
 
See how @antonioguterres & the UN family came together to call for urgent #ClimateAction following the release of a major new climate report from the @IPCC_CH. https://t.co/9eSNGeFBHw

"There is no excuse for denying the world’s 476 million indigenous peoples self-determination and meaningful participation in all decision-making."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's #IndigenousDay. https://t.co/hXYGroFtWB #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/HEMV0iZD1Z

Today’s @IPCC_CH report is a code red for humanity.  

The alarm bells are deafening and the evidence is irrefutable: greenhouse gas emissions are choking our planet & placing billions of people in danger.

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/ERCnwjOtHj https://t.co/mCqYUb7LD3

Happy #IndigenousDay! 

Today & every day, stand with indigenous women & girls as they strive for their rights, protection and a seat at the table where decisions that impact their lives are made. #WeAreIndigenous via @UN_Women https://t.co/AxeXZ2eUCr

"We are at imminent risk of hitting 1.5 degrees in the near term. The only way to prevent exceeding this threshold is by urgently stepping up our efforts & pursuing the most ambitious path."

-- @antonioguterres on urgent need for #ClimateAction. https://t.co/MeITKDWMz4 https://t.co/0HTTsoFaa2

1 million plastic bottles are sold per minute around the 🌎, adding to the plastic pollution that ends up in our landfills & oceans🌊.

You can make a difference & help #BeatPlasticPollution by using your own refillable bottle.

More #ClimateAction tips.➡️ https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/0KT8CBQmcE

There are more than 476 million indigenous people...
🔹 living in 90 countries
🔹 representing 5,000 different cultures
🔹 speaking the majority of the world's 7,000 languages

More from @UNDP on Monday's #IndigenousDay. https://t.co/b5Pe7MhRLe

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for the future. 

Our survival on this planet hinges on these few degrees.

Addressing the climate crisis & limiting temperature rise is possible, if we #ActNow. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n via @UNFCCC https://t.co/AQbfsRGrMv

Monday is #IndigenousDay - a time to celebrate indigenous peoples everywhere & their contributions to our world. 

Find out more: https://t.co/bEhqDhl0Aj #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/clfWEp9xMr

Misinformation about vaccines is prolonging the pandemic. 

Take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation — and the virus. https://t.co/fBGWhntIrq #PledgeToPause https://t.co/uMAIBQ6wUy

Humanitarian action is urgently needed to help people living in 20+ places  where conflict, economic shocks, natural hazards & limited access are putting millions of lives at risk. 

Latest #HungerHotspots Report from @FAO & @WFP: https://t.co/fxt1u3bihd https://t.co/3zRo1f5jS9

Less than 2% of vaccines have been administered in low-income countries vs 50% in high-income countries. 

Low & lower-middle income countries urgently need support to vaccinate their populations against #COVID19. https://t.co/YRjPPT4jgT via @UNDP

Youth have been looking for opportunities to help Beirut recover following the devastating blast that rocked the city one year ago.

Read how @UNICEF is supporting these young people as the Lebanese capital looks to rebuild. https://t.co/zmW4sThPOc

The climate crisis has not stopped amid #COVID19. Delaying #ClimateAction costs livelihoods & lives.

#ActNow to help protect our planet & our future: Switching off lights can save more energy than it takes for the light to start up again. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/sXix06FnYY

"The cat did not have a home, like us."

🐱 Salen was adopted by Francesca & her family, who fled the political crisis in Nicaragua.

On #InternationalCatDay, join us in celebrating our feline friends for providing comfort & improving mental health during times of difficulty. https://t.co/oKZAKtSFOa

"My rights over my land are more important than anything, because everything I need can be found on my land." 

Ahead of Monday's #IndigenousDay, meet the Hadzabe -- one of the last remaining hunter-gatherer tribes & winners of @UNDP's Equator Prize. https://t.co/Un9zduVtKd https://t.co/jAAg9IuWDw
